description:
Allgaiera indica is a species of plant that belongs to the family Asteraceae. It is a perennial herb native to the Indian subcontinent, primarily found in India and Pakistan.

The plant is characterized by its erect, branching stems that can grow up to 1 meter in height. The leaves are simple, alternate, and lanceolate in shape, with serrated margins. The inflorescence is a capitulum, consisting of numerous small, yellow-colored flower heads.

Allgaiera indica is known to thrive in a variety of habitats, including grasslands, scrublands, and disturbed areas. It is considered a hardy and adaptable species, capable of growing in a range of soil types and environmental conditions.

The plant has been the subject of some scientific research, with studies investigating its potential medicinal properties and potential uses in traditional medicine. However, more extensive research is still needed to fully understand the biology, ecology, and potential applications of this species.
